item.description:
Established in 1638 as a land grant to Samuel Appleton, Appleton Farms is one of the oldest continuously operating farms in the United States. Scenic views of rolling grasslands, grazing livestock, ancient stone walls, tree-lined carriage paths, and historic farm buildings are all part of the legacy of nine generations of Appleton family members kept alive through the work of The Trustees of Reservations.

Six miles of footpaths, bridle paths, and farm roads (easy walking), some of which are part of the Bay Circuit Trail. I am not sure about dogs - I think you need a "green" pass. Check the contact info below. I suggest waterproof footwear as this is "mud season." We will walk for about 2 hours.

Here is the link.
http://www.thetrustee... There is a $3 parking fee.
Headquarters: Appleton Farms 219 County Road, Ipswich, MA 01938 978-356-5728

We will meet at the Waldingfield Road Parking area - near the intersection of County Road. If you Mapquest 219 County Road, Ipswich it will get you close.

From the South take I-95N to Rt 128N, take exit 20A and follow Route 1A north for about 7 mi. Turn left onto Waldingfield Road and look for entrance immediately on left at corner.

From the North take I-95S take exit 54 for MA-133 toward Rowley. 133 will combine with 1A near Rowley. Stay on 1A South which will become County Road (I don't have the mileage). Then go right onto Waldingfield Road and look for entrance immediately on left at corner.

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Appleton Farms Walk, Ipswich, MA
